intro: Erigeron mirus, commonly known as the fairy dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its flowers are small, white to pinkish, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Erigeron mirus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
